#n, k0
{2, -5}
#Integrated cross section, s = sign(k0), m = |k0|; {s*(m-2), -s(m-1), sm, -s(m+1), s(m+2)}
{1, 1, 6, 1, 1}
#coefficients 5x5 table, rows and column index refer to the same kappa as the column index for the integrated cross section
{{0.4081632653061224, -0.2763278368923796, 1.638688327044607, 0, 0}, {-0.2763278368923796, -0.6462585034013605, -0.6463819442276294, -1.011542982298521, 0}, {1.638688327044607, -0.6463819442276294, -5.529720245233915, 0.7368834449027982, 2.618433603770193}, {0, -1.011542982298521, 0.7368834449027982, -0.03496503496503497, 0.1682063760287986}, {0, 0, 2.618433603770193, 0.1682063760287986, 0.8791208791208791}}
#The one photon case follows. The final kappas are sorted as {s(m-1),-sm,s(m+1)} and the coefficients then end up in a 3x3 table instead.
#Denominator coefficients:
{1.0, 1.0, 1.0}
#Numerator coefficients:
{{0.33333333333333333333, 0.20100756305184241510, -1.47709789175199279282}, {0.20100756305184241510, -0.96969696969696969697, -0.22268088570756164529}, {-1.47709789175199279282, -0.22268088570756164529, 0.63636363636363636364}}
